creator: ivddd@yahoo.com.cn
text:
Created attachment 25805
The response time from jmeter

Reproducible: Some time issue. 20% for each response time.
This is the issue for response time from jmeter.

I have record the request from site and run these request, but some of response time is larger than actual response time.

E.G. 
The request of http://www.x.com/note

Thread Name: Thread Group 1-1
Sample Start: 2010-07-27 08:46:50 PDT
Load time: 104555
Latency: 104555
Size in bytes: 239
Sample Count: 1
Error Count: 0
Response code: 200
Response message: OK

it shows 104sec for response time.
but actual for YSlow and Firebug, it's just 1 sec.
Also I have catch the time by manual with windows time.
It used 1 sec got the response time when running the scripts but it's show 104555 on Jmeter.

but this is not reproduce always and not only on designated request.
It has more than 20% in one round performance testing.
And it's randomly on each request.


(Please refer the screen shot in attachment.)

creator: milamber@apache.org
text:
Probably not a bug.
I suppose test conditions with JMeter / Firebug / YSlow are not same? (users, duration, iteration, etc.)

Sound like a garbage collector execution on server (each x iteration).

Please send your request on Jmeter user list.

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
As far as can be ascertained from the report, this is not an error in JMeter.

If you can reproduce the error reliably, please re-open the bug, and attach the following:

JMX file
jmeter log file
JTL file showing sample results.
